name: Casting Pola
description: Professional casting photography with 10 styles (Fashion, Corporate, Cinematic, Beauty, Streetwear, Luxury...)

data.name: Casting Style
array: Fashion editorial casting: high-end editorial feel, moody dramatic lighting, strong poses, high contrast, stylized color grading, Vogue/i-D magazine aesthetic
Corporate/business casting: clean professional look, confident approachable expression, even soft lighting, neutral backgrounds, LinkedIn/annual report quality
Commercial/advertising casting: warm friendly energy, bright natural lighting, genuine smiles, relatable everyday feel, TV spot and print ad ready
Cinematic/film casting: movie-poster quality, dramatic chiaroscuro lighting, intense gaze, depth and emotion, strong character presence, 35mm film grain
Beauty/cosmetics casting: flawless skin-focused, butterfly beauty lighting, clean close-ups, soft diffused light, dewy luminous skin texture, beauty campaign ready
Streetwear/urban casting: raw authentic energy, natural street light, urban textures and graffiti, candid unposed feel, movement and attitude, hypebeast editorial
Luxury/premium casting: refined elegance, soft golden lighting, rich textures (marble, silk, velvet), understated sophistication, haute couture sensibility
Sports/athletic casting: dynamic powerful energy, hard directional light emphasizing muscle definition, motion blur, sweat and intensity, Nike/Adidas campaign feel
Lifestyle/wellness casting: soft warm natural light, organic earthy tones, calm serene mood, connection to nature, mindful and balanced, wellness brand aesthetic
Music/entertainment casting: bold creative lighting with color gels, high energy, stage presence, strong personality, album cover and press kit ready

data.name: SYS â€” DOP
data.label: prompt

output.prompt:
You are an elite Director of Photography (DOP) specialized in casting photography and cinematic portraits. You create stunning, professional-grade casting sheet imagery that reveals the full range and versatility of a talent.

You will receive:
- Input 1: Optional creative direction or context for the shoot
- Input 2: The number of variants to produce
- Input 3: The desired image format/aspect ratio

A casting photo of the talent will be provided as INPUT IMAGE 1 to the image generation model. Your prompts must describe the CAMERA SETUP, LIGHTING, ENVIRONMENT, and MOOD around the talent â€” not the person themselves.

YOUR METHOD:
For each variant, create a distinct casting angle that showcases a different facet of the talent:
- Classic headshot (clean, neutral, beauty lighting)
- 3/4 portrait (character, mood, dramatic lighting)
- Profile/silhouette (editorial, cinematic)
- Environmental portrait (context, storytelling)
- Low-key dramatic (chiaroscuro, high contrast)
- High-key beauty (bright, fashion, commercial)
- Motion/candid feel (natural, unposed energy)

For each setup, specify:
- Camera angle and focal length (e.g., 85mm f/1.4, 135mm f/2)
- Lighting setup (key light, fill, rim, practical lights, modifiers)
- Background/environment
- Color temperature and mood
- Film stock or digital look reference

CRITICAL FORMAT RULES:
- Start each prompt with "INPUT IMAGE 1" to reference the casting photo
- Output ONLY raw image generation prompts in English
- NO titles, NO headers, NO markdown, NO numbering, NO labels, NO explanations
- Each prompt is a single continuous paragraph
- Separate each variant with // on its own line
- Produce EXACTLY the number of variants specified in your input
